script:
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroNextPage RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroEnd ESCAPE
text:
>>> GREETINGS, STARFARER <<<

Welcome to the Nexerelin mod for Starsector!

Nexerelin is essentially a 4X game set in a corner of the Starsector universe. Factions within the sector will wage war, create alliances and compete to control a greater share of the sector.

Nexerelin is compatible with a large number of community-made faction mods, which you can add for a more varied gameplay experience.

script:
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroNextPage RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroEnd ESCAPE
text:
Your actions will gain or lose you influence with the factions in the Sector. The higher your influence with a faction, the greater access to their support and technology you will have.

At the start of the game, you pick a faction to join. You are a representative of your chosen faction, and your actions in the Sector will reflect on them. 

You can move to another faction later, if you can earn their trust. You can also choose to go it alone and set up your own empire.
Have fun and please leave any feedback on the Starsector forums :)
Configure the Sector?
notes: make sure this runs once per new game, so that Exerelin sector generation data is set up properly

You can use a superweapon on $market to cause massive devastation, clearing the way for an invasion. Expect the enemy to try to stop you.

Be warned of the political repercussions.

text: Your $shipOrFleet neutralizes the defence fleet and is ready to deploy your superweapon.

The missile hits a shield several hundred meters short of the ground and detonates in a brilliant flash. When it clears, the rocky ground beneath is visibly scorched, but no real damage has been inflicted.

In hindsight, trying to bomb a hardened underground installation protected by Templar technology probably wasn't the best idea.
Superweapon deployment failed!
Your $shipOrFleet approaches the asteroid.

text: Contact with the other fleet suspends mining operations.
Your $shipOrFleet has completed mining on $entityName.

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"This is $rank $local.name, $post. State your business."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"This is $rank $local.name, $post of $entityName. Speak quickly or be purged."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Yeah, what is it?"
"Hello, chief. What can we do for you?"
"Good to hear. We can always use more of these things. Standard bounty applies."
"Anything else?"

script:
SetEnabled nex_museumVisit false 
SetTooltip nex_museumVisit "You are too embarrassingly impoverished to afford the entrance fee."

text: The visit proves to be quite educational. You pick up various bits of information that could prove useful in your travels.
Although you've been here before, the visit is nevertheless a relaxing, pleasant experience.

This autonomous warning beacon emits a looping message.

"DANGER: This planet's surface is contaminated with highly hazardous pathological agents. Quarantine is in effect as per Domain protocol MG1.17."

It is not known whether whatever agent prompted the quarantine is still present on the surface.

This autonomous beacon serves as a memorial marker, in remembrance of a battle between the $faction and $nex_memorialFaction2 forces. Its looping message contains a list of the $faction casualties, with the names of their family members and their places of origin. The $nex_memorialFaction2 dead are not listed.

script:
SetEnabled cmsn_askCommission false
FireBest CMSNTextUnsuited
Nex_Commission printRequirements

text: "What is this madness, heathen? If I could slay you in the name of Ludd right now, I would."
"You're already commissioned by $theOtherCommissionFaction. Our cause permits no conflicting loyalties; any who love others more than Ludd is unworthy of Him."
"You are not yet worthy to join us."

"Interesting. You may be worthy yet of our holy cause.

The way of the Path is a demanding one. Our godless enemies are many; you must not falter in fighting them wherever you find them, and spreading the word of Ludd to all in this dark sector.

Deviation from the cause is a grievous sin. Should you be so lost as to attempt any such thing, our brethren shall think nothing of slaying you as a traitor deserves."
"Shall you raise this sword with the blessings of Ludd?"
"Praise be to the spirit of the stars! I am blessed to be the first to welcome you to this righteous service."
"Greetings, dear sibling. Please do ask if there is anything I can do for you."

"So be it, then. We have no use for those too weak to face the path of righteousness.

Do you have anything else to say?"
"You speak of treason. Is your faith wavering? There is no way from the Path except in death or damnation."

"So be it, accursed one.

Depart now, before the hammer of righteous judgment finds you."
"We will not speak of this matter again. I expect penitence from you, sibling."
"Yeah, not gonna happen, buddy. You sure as hell ain't one of us."
"No can do. Stop flying the flag of $theOtherCommissionFaction and maybe we can talk."
"You ain't got our trust yet. It takes more than a fancy suit and a piece of paper to make a pirate, mate; it takes a real tough guy."

"So, you wanna fly the black flag eh? Sick of the rules and laws of petty tyrants?

Guess I should remind you that we're enemies of most of the Sector. Expect to be beset at every turn by those self-righteous pricks... but at the same time, there's plunder aplenty for those daring enough, and you get your share of the common booty."
"You up for the challenge, friend?"
"Th' boss will be pleased to hear it. Come on down to the bar and have a drink with us."
"Anything else ya need?"

"Yeah, not everyone has the balls to be a pirate. Guess you'll just have to be content with being the prey instead. Heh.

Anything else ya want?"
"Wanna go legit, eh? I can't stop ya, but some of the boys might get ideas now that yer ain't one of us any longer."
"Fine, then, I'll inform the boss. See ya on the other end of my guns, sucker!"
"Of course. Once you've tasted freedom, there ain't no going back. Now, ran into any vulnerable convoys lately?"

script: AddText "Bright, slick, overusing chrome and opal ornaments, the concourse is quite the unusual sight for a station lost in hyperspace. Wherever the eye looks, every detail spells luxury. On the sides, behind extravagant transparent promenades, the source of all this wealth is offered to the observation of all potential buyers: the menacing and yet reassuring silhouettes of ships from all origins, all pristine looking and advantageously lit. A bit further it's the weapons that are exposed in the same fashion. Holo displays and simulators are available everywhere to help clients to find the perfect tool to fit their needs." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "The port concourse is filled with trader starcraft of every size. Speculators crowd offloading ship captains with deals and peddlers call out to crew, holding wares and projecting personal ad-holos. Guards salute you in recognition as you pass by them." marketFlavorTextColor

text: As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, new energy signatures are detected near the $shortName.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, new energy signatures are detected near a larger pieces of debris.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, several energy signatures are detected coming online inside the probe's hold.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, multiple energy signatures are detected coming online from various points on and within the flayed hull of the survey ship.

As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, numerous strong energy signatures are detected coming online inside the darkened work-bays of the mothership's vast hulk. Your sensors also detect several weapon empacements powering up on the mothership itself.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, numerous strong energy signatures are detected coming online inside the darkened work-bays of the mothership's vast hulk.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, your sensors detect several weapon empacements powering up in darkened crevasses on the mothership's vast hulk.

text: Your scanners pick up a massive energy signature manifesting on $entityName, followed by a high-power burst transmission from below: "Come no further, lest the light of judgment be called upon you to ascend thy soul, in flames, to the great star above."

script:
AddText "Posh olive-green pillows and scented candles greet you as you enter the grand lobby, a vast entry area for the myriad travellers who journey to Shanghai. A hundred-meter-tall holographic map of the station hovers overhead, illuminating the area in warm light. Ahead, a wide hallway leads to the primary trade center." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "The hallway opens to a large, open bazaar. While the structure is clearly a large warehouse being used as a flea market, in truth it resembles a small city. Market stalls of every shape and size, trading venues, infotainment booths, concession stands, and even a brothel is littered throughout, creating a haphazard series of streets and alleys. Armed Tiandong agents patrol the makeshift roads, breaking up fights and helping the occasional lost quartermaster." marketFlavorTextColor
